website_summaries.verdict: With Wi-Fi, an LCD, and a waterproof body, as well as some nice accessories, the Drift HD Ghost uses its features to beat back the action cam competition.
pros: The Drift HD Ghost packs in all the features competitors charge extra for, like a built-in LCD and Wi-Fi
it's waterproof without requiring a housing
it has a mic jack for an external mic
its battery life is very good, and the battery is removable
cons: The camera menu system, while easy to understand, can be a pain to navigate
video is very good, but is not without issues
and, as with many cameras, you'll have to supply your own microSDHC card for storage

customer_reviews.title: LOVE the Drift HD GHOST -- for my Harley-Davidson road trips!
customer_reviews.text: Love - love - love this gadget. I bought extra mounts for the front and back of my Harley-Davidson. Works like a charm. I've been doing time-lapse videos with this thing (easy-peasy with Aperture) and my pals on social media have been loving the footage I've been posting. Surprisingly great quality footage!! I will say, my only disappointment is with the little "remote" for your wrist. Nice idea -- but the battery in mine lasted only an hour or so, compared to the 3H battery in the Ghost. I'd suggest a re-design of that to use longer-lasting watch-batteries or something.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: I'm about to give up on this camera that up until now thought was very good.
customer_reviews.text: Mine has worked decent for the last 8 months, then the internal mic quit and the play all video feature. I've updated the firmware and no dice. I'm about to give up on this camera that up until now thought was very good. Update , I finally was able to get the firmware update to work, but only by installing it right onto the SD card while in my computer slot, not through the camera like the manual says to do it. The ext mic now works again, and the play all feature to watch all the videos one after another. Now lets see how long it stays working.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Walker

customer_reviews.title: Drift Camera, Great experience and Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera, one of the best purchases I've made in a long time. Great for any action sport or action event or even just doing a time lapse. I love it and think its a way better camera then the Go-Pro for the price and gives you more flexibility since you don't have to have that bulky cover like you do on the Go-Pro. The remote and Iphone apps are great additions for any camera but especially an action camera where you dont want to have to take it off and on your helmet to turn it on or off. Great camera and the additional ability to spin the lens is great.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Greenwald

customer_reviews.title: Good but flawed
customer_reviews.text: Screen shattered on first tumble. Had it attached to my helmet using their supplied stick-on mounts and it popped right off on the first spill. Gorilla glass? Not so sure. Seemed more like thin plastic. The picture quality and features are superior to the competition, but the screen shatter ruined it for me and Drift refused to fix it OR sell me parts OR sell me another one (they discontinued this model). It's a shame because I love the wrist control and the simple video format -- no special software required.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, mounted, and mostly with default settings- mounted this on my helmet for Adventure Touring/trails. First time out- I recorded 1.5 hours of footage non-stop, using 15% of the battery and about 4.5GB of data off a 16GB card. Loads more footage time and charge, this could easily go all day recording without recharge. My only complaint if WIND NOISE. I'll be adding a simple foam air baffle over the mic, otherwise sound was great. Comes with several mounts so you can quickly drop-out the camera and move it where ever you want, or stand it up for money shots.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy (no, the other guy)

customer_reviews.title: I had purchased my Drift HD Ghost Helmet Camera a ...
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased my Drift HD Ghost Helmet Camera a little over a year ago and had mainly used it as a motorcycle camera. However, today I attached the waterproof back onto the camera and took it with me white water rafting and after coming home the device no longer turns on. The only water that touched the camera during the trip was from the splashes of the rapids and it is now unusable. Keep in mind these rapids are only class II and III so they are not even that fast. Camera is NOT waterproof and they refuse to cover their warranty because of "user error". Don't market your camera as waterproof then if it isn't.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: useful mounting tools and addons and rather durable
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use, useful mounting tools and addons and rather durable, looses two stars because of the microphone whine that this device gives off. It's weird, but it whines because of the unshielded connection in proximity to the battery. You need to use a third party audio program to remove the whining sound you hear. I used Audacity to remove the high pitched sound. This glitch only occurs if you re using an external attached microphone

It does everything it says it will, but the control layout is clunky, the software app is slow and glitchy, and you're never sure if you're getting the shot or not. A good shot, and the quality of the images/movie is good. I particularly like the dash cam feature. The case is very resilient, and battery life is good on the camera... not so much on the remote.

Once it warmed up in ambient air, all was back to normal. Beware cold water.

product_meta.title: SVP Action Camera and Webcam (ActionCamera)
product_meta.description: Drift Innovation, the award-winning action sports technology company specializing in the capture and sharing of digital imagery, launched the most feature-rich and intuitive action camera yet - the Drift HD Ghost.Building upon a unique feature set, which includes an industry-first two-way LED remote control with on/off indicator light, video recording/tagging capabilities in continuous loop mode, and an integrated 2-inch Corning? Gorilla? Glass; LCD screen, the Drift HD Ghost is the best all-in-one solution on the market.Unlike other point of view cameras that require aftermarket accessories and peripherals for functionality, the Drift HD Ghost includes everything action sports enthusiasts need to capture professional quality video immediately. Plus, the intuitive interface is easy to use, easy to navigate and easy to set up, so users everywhere can begin recording moments after opening the box.
